title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 462.9 - Correction of a record or personal information or denial of request for a record or amendment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 462.9 - Correction of a record or personal information or denial of request for a record or amendment

State Regulations
(a) Denial
of a request for records or personal information or amendment or correction of
a record or personal information: (1)
shall
be in writing, explaining the reasons therefor; and
(2)
shall identify the person to whom an
appeal may be directed. (b) A failure to grant or deny access to
records or personal information within five business days of the receipt of a
request or within 30 days of an acknowledgment of the receipt of a request, or
a failure to respond to a request for amendment or correction of a record or
personal information within 30 business days of receipt of such a request, shall be construed as a denial that may be appealed. (c) Any such denial may be appealed to: David E. Blabey, Esq. Executive Vice-President, Secretary & General

Counsel

New York Power Authority
124 Main Street
15th Floor

White Plains, NY 10601

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
